title: Youth Against
content:
anyone any ideas?  
thanks

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202133216im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/youth_3939.jpg)

 [‹ Anyone able to tell me this font?](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202133216/http:/www.typophile.com/node/42839 "Go to previous forum topic") ["MODERN" Typeface? (ahh, the irony...) ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202133216/http:/www.typophile.com/node/42816 "Go to next forum topic")
author: YES

comments.content: Edward, that’s possible. The level of modification is heavy, and the “G” is significantly modified versus the “Y”, “H” and “A”. It’s also possible that the “G” was really a modified “O”. I’d be interested to see where this was used, it might help justify the modification.
